intro: Stilaginella oblonga, commonly known as the oblong stiltroot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to its arid or semi-arid habitat. Stilaginella oblonga is often found growing in rocky outcrops and is a hardy plant that can withstand periods of drought.
